description:
Beauveria bassiana is a species of entomopathogenic fungus, meaning it is a fungus that is pathogenic (disease-causing) to insects and other arthropods. It is a naturally occurring fungus commonly found in soils worldwide. Beauveria bassiana is known for its ability to infect and kill a wide range of insect pests, including beetles, caterpillars, aphids, and other agricultural and household pests.

The fungus infects its host by adhering to the insect's cuticle (exoskeleton), germinating, and penetrating the host's body. Once inside, the fungus proliferates, releasing toxins and eventually causing the death of the insect. Beauveria bassiana has been extensively studied and utilized as a biological control agent, as it provides an environmentally friendly alternative to chemical pesticides for managing various insect pest populations.

Due to its specificity and relatively low toxicity to non-target organisms, Beauveria bassiana has been developed into various commercial biopesticide products, making it a valuable tool in integrated pest management strategies in agriculture and other settings.
